TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed SystemGesture extends System.Enum

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the operating system recognizes system gestures, the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.StylusSystemGesture> event occurs. Many of the gestures map to traditional mouse events. For example, the Tap system gesture mimics a single left-click on a mouse.
## Examples The following example determines which type of system gesture that raised the <xref:System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture.Tap> event. This example assumes that there is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.InkCanvas> called `inkcanvas1` and that <xref:System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture> is connected to the event handler below.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture Drag = int32(19)

Docs.summary: Maps to a left drag on a mouse.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture Flick = int32(31)

Docs.summary: Occurs with a short, quick stroke that translates into a specific command. The action taken by a flick is set system-wide. An application can listen for a and prevent it from becoming one of the standard by setting the property to true in the event. Only Windows Vista supports flicks.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture HoldEnter = int32(21)

Docs.summary: Indicates that press and hold has occurred.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture HoldLeave = int32(22)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture HoverEnter = int32(23)

Docs.summary: Maps to a mouse hover. This can be used to show ToolTip rollover effects, or other mouse hover behaviors.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture HoverLeave = int32(24)

Docs.summary: Maps to a mouse leaving a hover. This can be used to end ToolTip rollover effects or other mouse hover behaviors.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture None = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture RightDrag = int32(20)

Docs.summary: Maps to a right drag on a mouse. This can be used to drag an object or selection to a different area and is followed by the appearance of the shortcut menu which provides options for moving the object.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture RightTap = int32(18)

Docs.summary: Maps to a right-click on a mouse. This can be used to show a shortcut menu.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture Tap = int32(16)

Docs.summary: Maps to a left-click on a mouse. This can be used to choose a command from the menu or toolbar, take action if a command is chosen, set an insertion point, or show selection feedback.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Input.SystemGesture TwoFingerTap = int32(4352)

Docs.summary: Maps to a double-click of a mouse.
